title._content: [Portrait of Arnett Cobb and Walter Buchanan, Apollo Theatre, New York, N.Y., ca. Aug. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Arnett Cobb and Walter Buchanan, Apollo Theatre, New York, N.Y., ca. Aug. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Arnette Cobbs [sic], former Hampton tenor man is now killing 'em on his own. Just a coincidence that the Apollo record star was caught at the Apollo theater here. Bass in the background is handled by Walter Buchanan. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 075 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Arnette's a double Apolloite," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 18 (Aug. 27, 1947), p. 12. Subjects: Cobb, Arnett, 1918- Buchanan, Walter Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Saxophonists--1940-1950. Double bassists--1940-1950. Apollo Theatre Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.01421 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0142
